io.puremetrics.sdk

Class PureMetrics.Revenue.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.puremetrics.sdk.PureMetrics.Revenue.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    PureMetrics.Revenue

    public static class PureMetrics.Revenue.Builder
extends java.lang.Object
    Builder class for PureMetrics.Revenue Object. Provides a convenient way to set the various fields of a PureMetrics.Revenue and generate associated payload which PureMetrics SDK can process

      • setPaymentProviderTransactionId

        @NonNull
public PureMetrics.Revenue.Builder setPaymentProviderTransactionId(java.lang.String transactionId)
        The ID using which the transaction can be identified in the payment provider's system. For example, In case of Stripe this is the 'balance_transaction' id which is returned with a charge response.
        Parameters:
        transactionId - id generated by the payment provider
        Returns:
        PureMetrics.FailedTransaction.Builder

      • setCurrency

        @NonNull
public PureMetrics.Revenue.Builder setCurrency(@NonNull
                                                        java.lang.String currency)
        Set the Transaction Currency. There can be only a single currency for a single transaction.
        Parameters:
        currency - Currency value has to comply with ISO4217,
        Returns:
        PureMetrics.Revenue.Builder

      • setDiscount

        @NonNull
public PureMetrics.Revenue.Builder setDiscount(java.lang.String discountCode,
                                                        long discountValue)
        Add the discount which is applied to the transaction. This is optional but there can be only a single discount per transaction
        Parameters:
        discountCode - Discount code used
        discountValue - Discount amount if any
        Returns:
        PureMetrics.Revenue.Builder

      • addMeta

        @NonNull
public PureMetrics.Revenue.Builder addMeta(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> meta)
        Add any additional information which you want to pass. This is optional
        Parameters:
        meta - Metadata associated with the revenue event. Example: name, product, category, location etc
        Returns:
        PureMetrics.Revenue.Builder

      • addPayment

        @NonNull
public PureMetrics.Revenue.Builder addPayment(@NonNull
                                                       java.lang.String mode,
                                                       long convertedAmount,
                                                       long fees)
        Add the Payment Details. If you are splitting the payment into wallets and cards etc, then add multiple payments with the amount specifically applied in that mode
        Parameters:
        mode - Payment Mode
        convertedAmount - Payment amount converted in the transaction currency
        fees - fess charged by the payment gateway if any
        Returns:
        PureMetrics.Revenue.Builder
